page.title: 02St Mary's Church Milston.
page.content: { Milston church}is about 725 years old and quite small.It seats 73 people but the average congregational attendance is 23.The present{vicar}is Phillip David Slater who also has two other Parishes of Figheldean and Bulford.Colonel Gow therefore looks after the church and locks it every night. { { Services }are only held there twice a month on the second and fourth Sundays.The church has a small{choir of 10 people.They all wear burgundy and white robes. There are 33 grave stones in the churchyard but none of them recently dated.The present burial site is found up the road in a nearby field. The church has 5{stained glass windows.On each window there is a picture taken from a story in The Bible.
